stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on Course 11 “Oily Boily Bay” underground: adding hydraulic-piston platforms, planning boiling-oil visuals, fixing bugs across earlier courses, coordinating texture memory with Biobak, and outlining remaining tasks before full beta testing.

development_findings.summary: Overall progress is ~75-80 % complete (Course 11 of 15); engine work largely finished and star count projected around 180.
development_findings.quote: This is course 11… so we are at least two-thirds done.

development_findings.summary: Kaze has met 14 consecutive self-imposed daily deadlines; current goal is bug-fixes plus blocking out the Oily Boily Bay underground area.
development_findings.quote: So far I hit every single deadline… my next deadline is to do bug fixes alongside the block-out for the OBB underground.

development_findings.summary: Chain Chomp (‘Chompy’) received a new HD model and additional action states, appearing with a 1⁄16 probability.
development_findings.quote: He has a new model too… there’s a 1 in 16 chance of the new actions happening.

development_findings.summary: Static platforms in the oil-rig interior are being replaced with variable-speed hydraulic pistons for a more mechanical feel; behaviour, culling and update-order bugs were debugged on stream.
development_findings.quote: I want this to look like it's a bunch of machines just working.

development_findings.summary: Kaze plans a reflective, bubbling ‘boiling oil’ surface using vertex animations, dark tar colouring and bubble particles.
development_findings.quote: Very reflective black tar boiling… smoke bubbles and some decals.

development_findings.summary: Doors and other animations remain broken until Lilaa’s quaternion-animation exporter arrives; current fixes would need to be redone.
development_findings.quote: Until we have Lilaa's quaternion animation exporter… we cannot fix the doors.

development_findings.summary: Texture memory limits (4 KB per chunk) forced a sail graphic into a ‘cursed’ 96×42 I-4 texture; Kaze and Biobak validated it for N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: This is the most cursed texture resolution I've ever seen.

development_findings.summary: Chosen joystick dead-zone will mimic RE64’s ‘two-zone’ approach, fitting the N64’s octagonal gate.
development_findings.quote: Second is a good choice… if you put four into a game you deserve to suffer.

development_findings.summary: Engine will be released open-source, but Kaze doubts anyone will undertake a PC port due to complexity and time.
development_findings.quote: I seriously doubt anyone is gonna have the skill to make a PC port of this.

development_findings.summary: A future 30 FPS mode fix may merge rendering and gameplay threads to improve performance.
development_findings.quote: If you are in 30 FPS mode…the rendering thread goes into the gameplay thread and that will allow us to increase the FPS.

development_findings.summary: File-select is a 3-D Sunshine-style level; game boots directly into it to ‘not waste your time’.
development_findings.quote: The game boots you directly into the file select. The game doesn't waste your time.

development_findings.summary: Level-design philosophy: difficulty only when a jump is ‘cool enough’; otherwise postponed to later levels.
development_findings.quote: I don't try to make the levels more difficult. I just put the threshold of how cool a jump has to be for it to be worth the difficulty lower.

development_findings.summary: An ‘oil puddle’ enemy (inspired by 3D World) is planned but not yet coded for Course 11.
development_findings.quote: We still need to program the oil enemy… like the enemies from 3D World.

development_findings.summary: Each course gets a unique Yoshi-coin colour; dark blue chosen for Oily Boily Bay and a tracking document is maintained.
Kaze wants to license Badub’s soundtrack and release it as an N64-cartridge ‘album’.
development_findings.quote: When RTYI releases, I want to pay the musician… and then release an album for RTYI as an N64 cartridge.

context_findings.summary: Kaze now works full-time at Gears for Breakfast while leading RTYI; uses strict personal deadlines to stay productive.
He distinguishes main channel (high-value videos) from ‘Kaze Clips’ (lower threshold) to avoid viewer fatigue.
context_findings.quote: On the main channel I only want to post when I actually have something important… on the second channel you generally just get way more content.

context_findings.summary: Ad-revenue spikes at Christmas and sponsorships (e.g., Honkai Star Rail) help fund development; he dislikes making videos and wants to hire help.
context_findings.quote: Around Christmas I’m making bank… I should hire people to just make videos for me because I hate making videos.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: rejects ‘modern game design made for people that are depressed and just want to erase time’; aims for meaningful experiences.
context_findings.quote: Modern game design is made for people that are depressed and just want to erase time, not for people that want to go have an experience.

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration at constant release-date questions but excitement about future Kickstarter to ‘make big money’.
context_findings.quote: Please don't spend the whole stream asking me for a release date again… Simultaneously with the release of RTYI we are going to start a Kickstarter…and then we will be able to just make whatever we want.

biobak.summary: Provided sail Blender file; collaborated with Kaze to down-size and re-encode textures within 4 KB N64 limit.
Discussed Yoshi-coin colour palette and suggested gold, dark blue, etc., ensuring each course has unique coin colour.
Supplied models/textures (e.g., Dory) and offered to adjust resolutions or formats on request.

badub.summary: Composer for RTYI; Kaze intends to purchase full rights to release soundtrack on physical N64 cartridge.
badub.quote: I want to pay the musician to have the rights to the music and then release an album for RTYI.

zeina.summary: Provided historical memory of ‘Hot-Tub Mario’ mod and engages in casual brainstorming; minor supportive presence.

key_stories.title: The Sail Texture Memory Crisis
key_stories.summary: A new ship sail exceeded the N64’s 4 KB texture cap. Kaze and Biobak had to invent a bizarre solution to keep visual fidelity without crashing the hardware.
key_stories.challenge: Sail texture was too high-resolution for the console’s 4 KB segment.
key_stories.process: Tested combinations of I-4 textures and calculated exact byte counts, finally settling on a non-standard 96 × 42 resolution.
key_stories.outcome: Texture accepted for hardware verification; sail will appear in-game without memory overflow.
key_stories.key_quote: This is the most cursed texture resolution I've ever seen.

key_stories.title: Building Hydraulic Life into the Oil Rig
key_stories.summary: The underground oil-rig section felt static, so Kaze overhauled it with animated piston platforms to match the theme and enrich gameplay.
key_stories.challenge: Level lacked motion and mechanical atmosphere.
key_stories.process: Replaced flat platforms with custom ‘piston’ behaviour, adjusted speeds, debugged culling and update-order issues.
key_stories.outcome: Working variable-speed pistons dramatically changed the level’s visual energy and added platforming depth.
key_stories.key_quote: I want this to look like it's a bunch of machines just working.

key_stories.title: Waiting for Lilaa’s Quaternion Exporter
key_stories.summary: Key animations remain broken because the team’s animation specialist vanished for a week, halting door fixes.
key_stories.challenge: Doors and warps glitchy; need quaternion animation support.
key_stories.process: Team jokes about Lilaa’s ‘death’, posts memorial; Kaze postpones fixes until exporter arrives.
key_stories.outcome: Feature on hold; doors will be redone once Lilaa returns.
key_stories.key_quote: Until we have Lilaa's quaternion animation exporter, we cannot fix the doors.

key_stories.title: Post-RTYI Financial Strategy
key_stories.summary: Kaze outlines a plan to launch a new Unreal Engine platformer via Kickstarter immediately after RTYI, aiming for financial independence.
key_stories.challenge: Need sustainable income beyond hobby ROM-hacking.
key_stories.process: Finish RTYI, develop Unreal demo, run Kickstarter alongside release.
key_stories.outcome: Strategy set; details kept private until closer to launch.
key_stories.key_quote: We are going to start a Kickstarter for this game in Unreal Engine and then we will make big money.
